properties.areaDesc: Centennial Mountains/Island Park; Big Hole Mountains
properties.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 4 at 3:28AM MST until February 7 at 6:00PM MST by NWS Pocatello ID
properties.description:
* WHAT...A long duration period of moderate to heavy snow
possible. 3 day total snow accumulations of 8 to 18 inches, with
12 to 24 inches possible north and east of Macks Inn and near
peaks and ridges above pass level. Winds could gust as high as
30 MPH.

* WHERE...The Island Park region and Big Hole Mountains, including
but not limited to Island Park, Raynolds Pass, Targhee Pass, and
Pine Creek Pass.

* WHEN...From Wednesday afternoon through Friday afternoon.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult due to snow covered
roads and reduced visibilities. The hazardous conditions could
impact the evening commute Wednesday, and the morning and
evening commutes Thursday and Friday.
properties.instruction:
Continue to monitor the latest forecasts and updates from the
National Weather Service in Pocatello, including possible warnings
or advisories. Begin planning now for a long period of slick and
difficult travel conditions across the watch area.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH FRIDAY AFTERNOON
